dungeon.domain

Class DungeonMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • dungeon.domain.DungeonMap

  • public class DungeonMap
extends Object
    The map object that hosts the tool objects for creating the dungeon.
    Author:
    tgtapio

    • Constructor Detail

      • DungeonMap

        public DungeonMap(int height,
                  int width,
                  int roomAttempts,
                  int maxDoorsPerRoom,
                  int multipleDoorsOdd)
        Constructor that stores the map size and creates the map object. Also creates a RoomBuilder to be used for creating rooms.
        Parameters:
        height - of the map, outer walls included
        width - of the map, outer walls included
        roomAttempts - at placing a room into the map
        maxDoorsPerRoom - each room can have up to this many doors
        multipleDoorsOdd - chance of creating an extra door is 1/this

    • Method Detail

      • initialise

        public void initialise()
        Runs the initialise process that uses RoomBuilder to set up walls (0) and empty space (1).

      • addRooms

        public void addRooms(int attempts,
                     int minRoomSize,
                     int maxRoomRandom)
        Loop for adding rooms to the map. Rooms are checked for collision and their size is randomised based on the parameters given.
        Parameters:
        attempts - of room placement **NOT THE ACTUAL AMOUNT OF ROOMS**
        minRoomSize - defines the minimum dimension length for the room, should not be less than 3 to avoid rooms with no floor.
        maxRoomRandom - defines x in the 0-x to be added to each room dimension

      • createMaze

        public void createMaze()
        Method to run the MazeBuilder in steps. Creates a perfect maze, filling the empty space left after placing the rooms.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Creates a string of the map.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        map as a string

      • toDebugString

        public String toDebugString()
        Creates a string of the map, showing segment ids instead of ASCII graphics.
        Returns:
        map described with segment ids.

      • getAddedRoomCount

        public int getAddedRoomCount()
        Retrieves the current room count number from RoomBuilder, subtacts one to get the actual number of rooms that were placed, and returns as int.
        Returns:
        number of segments, i.e. placed rooms + 1 for the original dungeon floor.

      • runCrawlerTest

        public boolean runCrawlerTest()
        Sets loose a crawler that goes through the map, returning true if it reaches every non-wall square, and false if the map is not valid for use.
        Returns:
        true if all non-wall squares can be reached

      • compareArrays

        public boolean compareArrays(int[][] map,
                             int[][] testMap)
        Compares the final map with the one mulled over by the crawler. If a discrepancy is found, i.e. a difference in size or a square crawler didn't reach but was supposed to, halts, and returns false.
        Parameters:
        map - the final map
        testMap - copy of the final map
        Returns:
        result of the validation check, true if crawler reached ever non-wall square

      • copyMap

        public int[][] copyMap(int[][] oldMap)
        Duplicates the given map (int[][]).
        Parameters:
        oldMap - to be copied
        Returns:
        clone of the old map

      • findFirstEmpty

        public Coordinates findFirstEmpty(int[][] map)
        Finds the first non-wall square on the map. Used to find a starting location for the test crawler.
        Parameters:
        map - int[][]
        Returns:
        Coordinates for the starting square.

      • setMap

        public void setMap(int[][] map)
        Sets a specific map, for testing use.
        Parameters:
        map - to test with

      • getMap

        public int[][] getMap()
        Gets the map, for testing use.
        Returns:
        the map arrays as int[][]

      • placeDoors

        public void placeDoors()
        Runs the DoorBuilder to connect segments (rooms and corridors) to one network.

      • fillDeadends

        public void fillDeadends()
        Fills the deadend corridors up, leaving only one corridor system that connects all rooms.

      • getCorridorSegments

        public int getCorridorSegments()
